channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Upton Close, Barnwood, 7th July
item.description:
Car not moved for several weeks. Location of parking makes it difficult for residents to get off drives. Enquiries made on street WhatsApp group - general consensus is that it’s an abandoned car.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Upton Close, Hucclecote, Gloucester
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Sign incorrect, 7th July
item.description:
This sign has been here for weeks now. It has been left over by national grid. The path is not closed on any part of the road

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 1-6, Clevedon Square, Rowanfield, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: H Mark missing for 27A Leckhampton Road, 7th July
item.description:
The H mark was not re-painted after roadworks For property 27A Leckhampton Road GL53 0AZ I believe it is a mistake as a H mark has been painted for 27 Leckhampton Road

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 27a, Leckhampton Road, Leckhampton, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: General road markings, lines and stud issues

item.title: Abandoned pink e-scooters, 7th July
item.description:
2 pink e-scooters in middle of pavement by Mill Reef Drive/ play park. Also 1 outside no. 36 Noverton Lane and yet another outside no. 54 Noverton Lane These are becoming more frequent on the Noverton estate. please identify the culprits and ban them from accessing the scooters. They block the pavement making it difficult for wheelchairs and pushchairs
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 1, Desert Orchid Road, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: I have cut my elbow, my knee and my brow as I have fallen over a huge 3 inch high lump of tar which is part of a very rough area of pavement in Ambrose Street. I would like someone from your department to contact me on 07838) 160920 my name is John Menzies Sylvenus Broad Close Road down Hatherley GL2 9PZ thank you., 7th July
item.description:
Just before the tea junction at Ambrose StreetI’m

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 5, Ambrose Street, St Paul’s, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Sharp dip in road, 7th July
item.description:
There is a sharp dip in the road outside number 39 on the road. This is a previous failed patch that’s sunken
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 27, All Saints' Road, Fairview, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Tree branches are overhanging my property (36 Midwinter Avenue), 7th July
item.description:
The tree is located on a green area which forma part of a walkway from Marsh Lane to the playing field. The Council has cut off large branches in the past. We were informed that the tree was going to be felled - not a good specimen, branches too near our property. The tree also causes a problem to the property on the other side of the green space. We have to deal with alot of leaf debris from this tree.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 36, Midwinter Avenue, Wymans Brook, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Tree is damaged problem, 7th July
item.description:
Customer reports a dead tree in this area and asks for ownership and take it down if necessary as it looks dead - please see image attached. I have informed the customer that this does not appear to be Highways extent
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: 2 signs discarded on grass verge, 7th July
item.description:
Redundant metal signs left behind - please arrange for collection- otherwise they’ll be there for years getting rusty - it’s not fair to leave behind, this is a community space and should be respected
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): A435, Bishop's Cleeve
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Signs & Barriers left behind by Contractor

item.title: Tree is damaged problem, 7th July
item.description:
Customer reporting rotten tree limb which he believes may be at risk of falling. In addition, vegetation at foot of tree is proving hazardous in terms of visibility when emerging from Malden Rd onto Wellington Rd.
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Sign left on verge folded on grass, 7th July
item.description:
Very annoying that redundant signs are thrown to one side discarded - it’s irresponsible & and environmental hazard
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Cheltenham Road, Winchcombe, Tewkesbury

item.category: Signs & Barriers left behind by Contractor

item.title: Redundant cones need collecting, 7th July
item.description:
On the junction of Gambles La/ New Rd & Two Hedges Rd there is a large cone which was used for roadworks but the road is now open. In the hedge opposite there is another cone - both need collecting. The signs that had been left were collected but not the cones - please arrange for someone to come back & take them away!!!
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): New Road, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Signs & Barriers left behind by Contractor
